statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

article.description: Marcus Posley scored a career-high 47 points, the most by a NCAA Division I player this season, and St. Bonaventure beat Saint Joseph's 98-90 on Wednesday night.
article.headline: Posley sets D-I season-high with 47 points in Bonnies' win
article.linkText: Posley sets D-I season-high with 47 points in Bonnies' win
article.story: ROCHESTER, N.Y. -- Marcus Posley scored a career-high 47 points, the most by a NCAA Division I player this season, and St. Bonaventure beat Saint Joseph's 98-90 on Wednesday night. Posley's mark was the most by an Atlantic 10 player since David West (47) in 2003. Posley made 15 of 19 shots, 6 of 7 from 3-point range and 11 of 12 from the foul line. The Bonnies (21-7, 13-4), who led by 15 in the first half and 13 at the break, held on despite allowing 62 second-half points to the Hawks (24-6, 13-4). Saint Joseph's erased the halftime deficit with 14 straight and led at 55-53 before St. Bonaventure pulled away for good with a 23-5 run. Saint Joseph's dropped into a second-place tie with St. Bonaventure and Dayton, one game behind VCU (14-3). Dion Wright added 22 points and Denzel Gregg scored 14 for the Bonnies. Shavar Newkirk and Isaiah Miles had 19 points apiece for the Hawks. Aaron Brown and DeAndre Bembry added 18 each.
